meaningMnemonic: You have <kanji>two</kanji> <kanji>flat objects</kanji> that make up your <kanji>tongue</kanji>. What kind of tongue is made up of two of anything? That's a tongue that's split, that's a <vocabulary>forked tongue</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. That's the case for the first two kanji, but 舌 actually uses the kun'yomi. Not only that, it's read here as じた, and not した.
